text: peace officers inclusion of federal officers amend rsa iii to read as follows officer or peace officer is any sheriff or deputy sheriff mayor or city marshal constable police officer or watchman member of the national guard acting under orders while in active state service ordered by the governor under rsa certified border patrol agent as defined in rsa i certified federal law enforcement officer as defined in rsa or other person authorized to make arrests in a criminal case new subdivision certified federal law enforcement officers amend rsa by inserting after section the following new subdivision certified federal law enforcement officers certified federal law enforcement officers powers of arrest for purposes of this section a certified federal law enforcement officer means a federal law enforcement officer who a is employed as a law enforcement officer of the federal government as an officer or inspector of the u s customs service of the department of the treasury or the u s department of justice including the federal bureau of investigation the drug enforcement administration the bureau of alcohol tobacco and firearms and the u s marshalls and has satisfactorily completed a course of study in new hampshire laws and criminal procedures approved by the police standards and training council at the expense of the officer s agency has been certified by the commissioner of the department of safety pursuant to paragraph ii and has taken an oath administered by the commissioner of the department of safety or by the commissioner s designee to uphold the constitution of the state of new hampshire the executive director of the police standards and training council shall certify a federal law enforcement officer who applies for certification if the officer satisfies the employment and study requirements listed in paragraph a certification under this subdivision shall automatically terminate immediately upon the officer s suspension or termination of employment from the federal agency in which he or she was employed at the time the certification occurred a certified federal law enforcement officer is authorized to make an arrest for violation of new hampshire laws anywhere within the state if the officer determines that it is necessary to do any of the following a protect an individual in the presence of the officer from the imminent infliction of serious bodily injury b provide immediate assistance to an individual who has suffered or is threatened with serious bodily injury c prevent the escape of any individual whom the officer reasonably believes has committed a crime in the presence of the officer d prevent the escape of any individual whom the officer reasonably believes has committed a felony under new hampshire law a certified federal law enforcement officer who makes an arrest under this section shall report the arrest without delay to the nearest new hampshire state police barracks a certified federal law enforcement officer who makes an arrest under the authority of this section shall have the same immunity from liability that a state or municipal law enforcement officer has under the laws of this state the state of new hampshire shall not be responsible for employment benefits supervision and defense of the certified border patrol agent including when exercising authority under this section this section is not intended to limit existing authority of federal officers under federal law or to interfere with the performance of federal duties by federal officers police standards and training council power to certify federal law enforcement officers amend rsa v to read as follows certify persons as being qualified under the provisions of this chapter to be police officers state corrections officers state officers certified border patrol agents or for the purposes of rsa certified federal law enforcement officers for the purposes of rsa and establish rules under rsa for the suspension or revocation of the certification of such persons in the case of egregious misconduct or failure to comply with council standards
